intro: Iozoste corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer, come in shades of blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
